places_with_reviews.name: Kadyawaril Shri Ganapati mandir Anjarle
places_with_reviews.address: V32R+JWM, Murdi-Anjarle Khadipulmarge Kadyavaril Ganapati Mandir Marg, Anjarle, Maharashtra 415714, India

reviews.text: Very beautiful temple. First footsteps of Ganpati bappa is here. The backyard pond had 1000+ turtles which age back to decades.

Kadyavaril Ganapati is a charming and ancient temple, creating a pleasant atmosphere for devotees. The adjacent Ganapati first step in stone enhances the spiritual ambiance. The temple offers a nice view from the top, contributing to an overall good experience.

Kadyawaril Shri Ganapati Mandir in Anjarle, highly recommended by my Konkani friend, is not only deeply spiritual but also impressively clean and well-maintained. Dedicated to Lord Ganesha and perched atop Anjarle hills, it offers a serene atmosphere and a unique feature: the footprint of the deity near the temple. With captivating stories shared by the poojari, this sacred site promises a spiritually enriching experience amidst pristine surroundings.

One of the famous temples of the Dapoli Taluka. It is about 30 km from Dapoli city.

This is the oldest lord Ganesh temple located in Anjarle village. Not only is the temple beautiful but also the surrounding nature is so amazing.

The story of this temple is that, the ganesh lord came from the Arabian sea to here. The Lord took the first step on the hill from the sea, there is a small footprint 👣 printed and locals built one small temple there. On the second foot they built one temple.

I have been here so many times in every season. Such a great nature and climate here is. Also we can see small anjarle khadi. And the other side is the arabian sea and anjarle beach.
In short such a great place it is.

Nice little temple. At the top of a hill, road is nice n steep. Ample parking. Clean washrooms are available. Temple is calm, we got laddoo each as Prasad maybe because of Diwali. There is a small walk to see foot print of Ganesh as well. From there city view can b seen. Small Shiva temple is also in same premises. A big well is present there too . Few stalls to sell sherbat or kokan based stuff is also available outside in parking

places_with_reviews.name: Suvarnadurga Fort
places_with_reviews.address: Suvarnadurg Fort, R38M+9QM, Dapoli, Maharashtra, India

reviews.text: This fort is located inside arabian sea, 3 km away from Harne village (Dapoli). Fort is good and has historical significance. Place is not much crowded but its worth to visit the spot in winter. Do not visit this place individually (Visit in group). On the south side of fort thier is one view point from where w'll get the panaromic view. Boat will take charge of 150-200 Rs per person.

This is a  beautiful place to visit . Try going early in the morning so that you can see the fort without the heat . The boatman will charge 200 Per Person . Luckily for us a group of 5 men joined us which made it a Quick trip without any waiting in the start point.

Once you reach the fort , they give you 30 mins time for you to sèe the fort which I feel is very very less . To go & see around will take atleast 60 mins .

Try taking a certified guide with you who can tell you about the historic past . We clicked some pics in the sea area at the starting of the fort which is a good place for people to take Pics . The place is not maintained at all beacuse of which you need to be extra careful at some of the spots as it can be slippery & there are no safety walls . So climb & go down carefully by being in the group .

You can also collect sea shells in the beach area 😎

The fort is located near Harne Bandar.
The Suvarndurg fort is located in Arabain sea. The ferry is available to reach the fort, it take 10 to 15 Minutes to reach it.
Only protective wall of the fort I. E. Tatbandi is in place, we can see the some evidence of inner construction of the fort.
It ia little risky to go by ferry since ferry boats are not customise for the passengers.
The charges of ferry is 200 per person.

Awesome fort. Amazing to see what enormous structures were constructed during those times. The fort is big and walkable. The problem for people with knee issues and senior citizens as steps inside the fort are huge. Nevertheless one can see the fort and move around inside the fort. The boat ride from jetty to fort and return is also nice. Kids enjoy it. It takes around 15-20 minutes to reach the fort from the jetty. Must visit. Highly recommended.
One of the best coastal fort with great view and boat ride is worth your time

places_with_reviews.name: Anjarle Lighthouse

reviews.text: Great panoramic view. Visit after 4pm but before 5.30. Small play garden for kids. Senior citizens have to climb lot of stairs.

We recently visited the light house. The place is still under construction, however the light house is operational. There are a total of 150 steps to climb. Charge per person is 10 INR and for camera 20 INR. Specifically note that the timing is from 4.00pm to 5.30 pm ONLY. The authorities are very stringent about it, however there is no clearcut timing written anywhere in the property. The view from the top is breathtaking. People with heart condition and Asthama could reconsider their climb to the light house tower.
It was closed due to maintenance. I have visited three weeks back. The campus was very well maintained. I wish I was able to visit thr lighthouse from inside.

Amazing place. Nicely maintained. Must visit when you are visiting this area. Kids will love it. Timing is important. It was from 4 to 5.30 pm when we visited. Scenic views all around. The beach is very nearby. You can walk to the beach. Approximately 600 meters from the beach. Nice view at night also. The steps up the light house are a little demanding, but worth it.

Lighthouse gate may be locked, but do ask someone inside lighthouse, and you can enter by getting Rs10 ticket.

Timing: 4:00PM to 6:00PM
Ticket charge: Rs 10 per person
Stairs : 10 floors

places_with_reviews.name: Anjarle Turtle Festival

reviews.text: You can witness the most incredible experience here. This is the most natural and organic process hence not sure whether you will definitely see when you go. But it is worth trying.

Great initiative by nisarga Mitra NGO,

Arjerle is the second place in Maharashtra to watch baby turtle hatching! One must definitely visit this place!

Timings : 7 am in morning & 6 pm in the evening

They charge 100 rs pp , ticket are valid for 4 days

Biggest highlight of this place is the beach is super clean & uncrowded unlike velas where during every weekend more than 4,000 tourist come!

Don't miss this place!

Saw 17 🐢 hatched!

It was awesome

It all depends on your luck weather you will get to see hatching or not! But the beach is very beautiful and clean!
Timing for turtle festival is 6:30 am and 6:30pm

Awesome experience to see newly born baby turtles. Captured their first movements. It’s really great to see them crawling towards Sea. The people involved in the team of preserving the eggs, bringing them to life & sending them back to the sea are really doing great work. Please let us know your official website for commercial contributions.

Anjarle beach is one of the beaches in konkan, known as breeding ground of olive Ridley turtles. Best season to go is March to April. Daily twice, morning 7 am and evening 6 pm, hatcheries are checked and new hatchlings are guided to sea. Baby turtles are adorable. Not much facilities in area, mostly homestay. Beaches are clean and have basic facilities.

places_with_reviews.name: Sunset view point, Pajpandhari

reviews.text: Best put to see sunset over the ocean. This point is on a slope. On the foot of the slope may be a village and beyond that its all ocean. You'll be able see Harne on the cleared out. Take care in case you're with the kids in spite of the fact that since the assurance railing put by the government was broken and stolen by local people. Oh
The view in the evening is excellent, more relaxing, couples can enjoy seating there
This is a point to view the sunset and the town below. Good thing is there is plenty of parking space for four wheelers and a platform from where you can see the view.

Must visit if you are on the way to dapoli or staying nearby , You can have panoramic view of villege based at shore . It gets crowded during sun set so I decided to go in the afternoon though it was sunny and hot but I got to have whole place to me for the time I was there ( but i believe sunset would be great choice ) Roads are not great not bad either so it's manageable.

Best place to view sunset over the sea. This point is on a hill. On the foot of the hill is a village and beyond that its all sea. You can see Harne on the left. Be careful if you are with the kids though because the protection railing put by the government was broken and stolen by locals.

places_with_reviews.name: Fattegad Fort

reviews.text: Fattegad Fort is very Beautiful place❤️ if you are a non vegetarian fish lover you must visit this place you will love this place. The fort is amazing and view is really very beautiful. If you are traveling to Harne Beach or Harne port must visit this place too. Best time to visit is in summer 🌞⛱️ season or in winter ❄️ season too. Lots of places nearby to visit and enjoy with family or friends or with loved ones.

Though its fort but there are no remains of the fortification on fort. Its a lighthouse now. The best time to visit here is after 4pm as you will get good photos. This place has good flow of air flowing from sea and you  can sit and relax here with family and friends till dawn as it can also be called sunset point. There is harnai fish market very close where you can purchase fish at very cheap rates.

Fattegad is walk able distance from the jetty. Small steps takes you to the top. There are around 4 water tanks on the fort.
It has the nice view of the harnai jetty on one side, while Suvarnadurg lie to the other side.

It is beautiful and secluded and a boat takes you there, but the inside of the fort is not very interesting. It is all in ruins with a lot of dry grass growing. It looks very creepy too. It has a few beautiful spots though, with good views. There are a lot of bats inside the fort. But near the entrance of the fort, you will find a small beach with extremely white sand and blue waters. That makes the whole trip worthwhile.
There is nothing left in the fort to see. Sunset can be enjoyable near the beach. Added photos of nearby Suvarnagarh Fort.

places_with_reviews.name: Padale Village
places_with_reviews.address: Mukkam Padle, Post Aade, Taluka Dapoli, Ratnagiri, V3JG+7G7, Dapoli, Padale, Maharashtra 415714, India

reviews.text: If you are a true nature lover: this is a place to visit. Don't believe anything that's said on Google! Visit and experience first hand!
Very nice place.. Neat and clean beach...
Very remote beach white sand beach not a lot of visitors this one does not activities or stall or shops near good for take out picknic

It's a beautiful place to visit with family and friends. Beaches are lonely and peaceful. Food is delicious here. Shardashree lodge is a great stay here. You must visit this place at one. I am gonna come here again with my friends.

Get away from Russian tourists and find out what the authentic MH lifestyle is like.
Beach is quite clean, water not that inviting. However, you can camp on the beach or choose between 2 rather basic guest houses. Local food cooked by Mama Jadhav will leave you drooling.
Recommend if you want to get off the beaten track!
